EndosymbiontModel 0.0.1
  • Reference

    Plant infections

    plant_infect.Rd

    Calculate number of infected plants per time step

    Usage

    plant_infect(Ph, Pi, Awt, Ai, Awtp, Aip, Ac, temperature, prop_day, Amt)

    Arguments

    Ph

    Population of healthy plants (Plants/m2)

    Pi

    Population of infected plants (Plants/m2)

    Awt

    Density of wild type insects (Insects/m2)

    Ai

    Density of infected insects (Insects/m2)

    Awtp

    Number of newly produced wild type insects in time step (Insects/m2)

    Aip

    Number of newly produced infected insects in time step (Insects/m2)

    Ac

    Carrying capacity of paddock (Insects/m2)

    temperature

    Mean temperature during time step (C)

    prop_day

    Proportion of day within temperature thresholds

    Amt

    Movements of insects per day

    Value

    Pi the new population of infected plants at time step

    Details

    Calculate the new population of infected plants at the end of the time step, using the following set of equations: $$ A_{f} = \frac{{A_{wt} + A_{i}}}{{A_{c}}} $$

    $$ P_{n} = \frac{{A_{mt} \cdot A_{i}}}{{(A_{wt} + A_{i}) \cdot A_{n}}} $$

    $$ P_{i} = P_{h} \cdot \left(1 - e^{-\frac{{P_{n}}}{{P_{h} + P_{i}}}}\right) $$
